intro: Nemastylis purpurea var. major, commonly known as the purple nemastylis, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking purple to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. The flowers are clustered in whorls and bloom during the warmer months, attracting various pollinators.
